list.item: Insert Date of Last Edit Last checked

div2.head: 7 Tuesd.
The @ 5. 78
[The old artifacts]
[that the Arabs found]
[found at]
[Tellow]
div2.p:
At 0.30 am arrived at Amara
landed 44 1/2 passengers and
14 packages; There are no wool
ready for us to ship from
Lynch's Press, there are 260 Bales
which will be shipped by Khalifah
& this is the last lot for the
season~ Dowd the Christian
man of business of Rufail Sayegh
came to me with an arab bringing
about 30 pieces of Tablets of
Terra Cotta but all in fragments
he had gone to Tellow on the
Hai where De Sarzec was lately
excavating, he had three large
Bags full of these concealed
among the ruins, but some
Soldiers had followed him
from Shetrah & ceased the
whole lot & confiscated them
So he could not get them
& had to return with these
few broken ones which are
worthless~

At 2,,30 am we left Amara
fine cool night, I had to
sleep in my cabin~ At 5,,45
passed Kalat Saleh, Took
5 passengers from Amara
and one from K. Saleh~

At 8,,50 passed Azair~ X
Light N.W. & fine cool weather,

At 4,,10 P.M. arrived at
Basreh, only the mail Str-
Kapurthala here~ There are
only 365 packages cargo to Ship
by this mail steamer~

The weather here they say
has been fine & cool since
the 20th Ulto 3 days after we
had left Basreh last time,
there had been been no other
cases of sunstroke or heat
appoplexy since Mr. Perry
of the Ottoman Bank died
on the 27th & also the Doctor
of the SS. Gorgi of Darby Andrewes
and these two cases
div2.head: [The Cholera]
[(a conflict about it)]
[Flefleh]
div2.p:
were first attributed to Cholera
as Dr. Dobbin (a young English
Doctor who has been here about
8 months ago) insisted that it
was, but it turned out a mistake,

I went to Rufail's place at
the Huts at Rubat with Rezooki
Marine, also Michail Yaghchi
came (he had come down in
the Khalifah) he dined with
us & went to Sleep at Asfar’s
home, where many others are
also sleeping there, Mr. Lander
who came down in the Khalifah
to replace Mr. Perry has received
orders to return with us, he
is living in Asfar's house;

Weather got very calm with
very little dew, but the night
was not warm~

div2.head: 8 Wedn
div2.p:
Light air from N.W., at
7 1/2 am I came on board,
The Baghdad left at 6 am
up river to tow down the
Ressafah from Flefleh her
shaft being broken down
div2.head: 1894 Augst
div2.p: breeze got up from the N.W.

At 1 P.M. the Malamir
arrived from the Karoon river,
Mr. Taylor is not here & has
gone to Bushire by last
mail~ We finished the cargo
at 10 am~ We have very
few passengers~ The
weather is not so warm,
But at 3 P.M. it begun to
get calm & warm; Rufail
Michail Yaghchi, Rezooki
& others called on board until
we left~ The Mossul
is ready to leave only
herself without a Barge
to take up the Barge of the
Ressaffah from Flefleh
but is waiting for us;

Dates have commenced
to get ripe since few days
ago~

At 5,,10 P.M. left Basreh
ship is drawing 3 feet;
The Mossul left about 15
minutes after us~ Light
N.W. breeze; It became very calm
& moisty, the cabin is unbearable
from the heat; it was like
last trip up very nearly, had
the breeze not been from N.W.
It remained so moisty and
warm till 9 P.M. when
the breeze begun to get little
dryer,~

[space] at 11 landed one passenger
at Gorna & went on at 11.5
weather became cooler &
I could sleep then better

div2.head: 9 Thursd.
div2.p: Light N.W. & fine cool morning

At 3.5 am passed Azair,
Finished with the passengers
We have in all 82 Deck
none in cabins~ No one
overhauled the passengers~
div2.head: 1894 Augst
div2.p:
At 7.35 landed 3 passengers
at Kalat Saleh and went on;

At 0,,30 P.M. arrived at Amara
landed 12 passengers~
Very strong wind is blowing,
we shipped about 30 packages
of wool etc;

At 1.30 P.M. left Amara;
took 30 passengers and 12
men the workers at Lynch's Press
including Jejo Moorad the
Clerk and Rezooki Georgis the Engineer
all free to Baghdad having
finished with the wool
pressing, also 6 men
wool pickers etc of Shahbender
and Meer Gorgi free in all
we took 48 passengers

Modte N.W. wind and fine
at 7.30 P.M. passed Ali Sherghi,
fine moon light night 8 days
old;~ The wind was too strong
I was obliged to go into my cabin
at 12 P.M. ~
div2.head: 10 Frid
The 5. 84 Noon 96 4 P.M. 102
The. @ 5.78 Noon 93 4 P.M. 98
div2.p:
[space] At 0,,40 AM. landed one
passenger at Ali Gherbi &
went on at 1 AM.; Strong
N.W. wind blowing out not
cool ~ At 5,,45 passed
Sheikh Saad~

[space] At 12 AM arrived at
Coot landed 8 passengers,

[space] At 1 P.M. left Coot, shipped
9 Bales wool, & 92 1/2 passengers
(one in 1st Class the wife of
Yousef Eassayi and her 4 young
children)~ Fresh wind
from N.W. & pleasant weather,

[space] At 8,,5 P.M. passed Memlah
Modte N.W. and fine cool night;
[space] At 12 touched at the upper
part of Shedeiff & got off after
10 minutes~

div2.head: 11 Satur
div2.p:
[space] At 0.30 AM. touched again
sent the Pilot to sound and
till 3 AM when we got
over though an other channel
and proceeded~
div2.head:
1894 Augst
Weather very fine cool, I
slept in the cabin & found
very cool; Modte N.W.
breeze blowing~ At 6,,20
landed the empty Bags of
the Liquorice at Azizieh
and went on at 6.30~
div2.p:
[space] At 9.45 passed Baghdadieh
Fort~

[space] At 3.30 P.M. passed Bostan,
Light N.W. breeze & fine weather

[space] At 5.30 passed Ctesiphon
At 7,,40 passed Diala,
Light N.W. & fine cool night

[space] At 10.55 landed the
mails at the Residency;
I landed too & went home,
found Eliza, Alexander and Tookyeh
all well,~ There are lots of
fever, diarrhea & indigestion
among the people here, it
must be from the cold wind
at night, & the indulgance
in fruit eating etc etc,
div2.head: [A year passed since the death of Naoom Serkis (my father)]
[Iskender Svoboda in Istanbul, and the news of the earthquake]
1894 Augt
div2.p:
all well & they are encamped
in the garden of Petit Champs
(which I know well) opposite
their Hotel of Pera called
Hotel de Bristol et de Londres,
great damage has been
done in the town, mosques
houses, streets & palaces
fell down & ruined and
great loss of property and
people crushed~

div2.head: ' 13 Mond.
div2.p:
Light N.W. & fine cool
morning; At 7 am I
called on Menusha Henry's
Wife & then came on
board~ The S.S. Phrat left
this morning at 5 AM~
I went home at 10~ I feel
unwell my stomach is very
weak & feel very billious~
Johny called in the evening,

[space] The S.S. Mossul & Barge
arrived at about 12 AM.

Weather got warm in the
evening & a light S. Ely
div2.head: The @ 5. 76
[Prohibition of circulating the Rupees]
14 Tuesd.
div2.p:
[space] Light N.W. & fine cool morning
at 7 1/2 am I called on Antone
Marine there came Jeboory
Asfar & his wife & children,
they had just come in from
the garden to spend tomorrow
in town being a Holy day of
the Virgin ~ at 9 I came
on board, Sent money to
the office; I had to send the money
down in the ship's boat with Metty
to a beach where Hamadi received
it & took it to the office, as the
Custom House would not permit
any Rupees to be passed into
town for circulation it has
been prohibited since two months,
and the most coin in circulation
here is the Rupee which is
still worth 24 R. Piasters ~

I went home at 11 ~ Had a bath
of cold water ~

Artin called in the
evening ~ Light N.W. and
div2.head: 1894 Augst
div2.p: fine cool night.

Modte N.W. & fine cool weather
Today is a Holy day of the Assension
of the Virgin Mary ~ I went

div2.head: ' 15 Wedn.
div2.p:
to the Latin church & then called
on Mons Achille, Adoola and
Eliza my cousins, on Asfar
where I saw Jeboory & his
wife, Apikyan, Catterina
Yaghchi, sister Eliza, Menusha
SheKoory Sayegh & Tanton,
many people called to wish Tookyeh
a happy returns of her Holy day,
At 4 p.m. called on Shemoony
Ghorghis Tessy, on Yacoob Pehlawan
& on Hannosh Tessy's son Yousef,
Jeboory Asfar, Anton & his
wife & children, Artin Apykyan
& others called on us ~

Modte N.W. & fine cool
weather ~

div2.head: 16 Thursd
div2.p:
Modte N.W. wind & fine;
at 7 am called on Sister Eliza
& then came on board,
The Mossul hauled out &
the Mejidieh went alongside
div2.head: The @ 5. 78
div2.p:
to load ~ We shipped
some cargo wool etc & 600
Bags of wheat of Muir Tweedy
at 11 went home & returned
at 2 P.m. ~ At 5 1/2 went home
weather fine & light N.W.
breeze ~

div2.head: ' 17 Frid
div2.p:
Light N.W. & fine cool weather,
at 4 am we were up, we
are to ride out to Gherrara
to find a place where we
can encamp this autumn,
at 4 3/4 Eliza, Alexander,
Tookyeh also Menusha
Henry's wife & Louisa, Artin
my nephew & Alice my
niece rode out, the weather
is very fine & cool but
the dust flying about
from the beasts is awful,
we went as far as the
Bridge below Gherrarah
& came back along the
river to Michail Mina's
property near a grove
div2.head: 1894 Augst
div2.p:
of Poplar, we found good
place where Johnston was
encamped last year, also
above it near the grove,
we then returned to town
& got to our house by 8 1/4
am ~ at 9 I came on
board; ~ at 10 1/2 went home
took a cold bath; at 3 P.M.
called on Alice & Sister Emilia.
at 6 P.m. Blockey & his wife
called on us, also Johny
& Artin ~

[space] Weather commenced to
get little cloudy, some clouds
appeared on the East and
gradually spred up during
the night ~ Wind N.W.
& cool ~

div2.head: ' 18 Satur
div2.p:
[space] Light S.W. & Cloudy in patches
over & on the Eastern parts,
at 7 am called on Menusha
& came on board ~
We are shipping wool;
At 11.10 am the S.S. Mossul

& Barge left [PAGE TORN]
laden with cargo & few passengers,
at 11 1/2 I went home to breakfast
& returned at 1 1/2 P.M. ~ weather
warm with some clouds;
we shipped about 109,000 Okes
cargo & having few passengers

At 5 3/4 P.M. went home
with Alexander ~ Light
N.W. breeze & still cloudy
all around ~

div2.head: 19 Sund
div2.p:
[space] Modte N.W. & Clouds still
hanging on; at 3 1/4 am
I came on board ~

[space] At 4,,5 am got underway;
weather cloudy a little & a
fresh N.W. wind; having
over 108,000 Okes of cargo on
board ~

[space] At 6,,10 passed Diala
river ~ At 6,,50 grounded
near the Island of Zumbaranyeh
took out an anchor aft &
hove off, sounded also, at
